Description: Glazed composition dice, with white, now dirty ivory, glaze finish. The holes were filled with darker material before firing. Glaze has very smooth hard and glassy surface, core -hard and reddish, both features unlike other glazed composition objects from Naukratis, either Saite or Hellenistic.
Curator's comments: Numerous solid six-sided (cubic) dice, predominantly of limestone with drilled pips (but also of faience, ivory, marble, pumice and terracotta) were found at Naukratis. Parallels known from the 7th century BC, but are particularly popular in the Roman period (Cool 2016, 229-231). Cool, H. E. M. 2016. The small finds and vessel glass from Insula VI.1 Pompeii: Excavations 1995-2006. Oxford: Archaeopress, Roman Archaeology 17.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (TH.02)
Condition: Good, chipped corners, caused through use in antiquity.
